snippet.textDisplay: I'm just going to say that I know I'm late to commenting on this one but, the hypocrisy with him defending somebody else against Warner's abuse is mind-boggling when he hasn't come out yet and defended Johnny Depp against Amber Heard. There's an interview where she's punching him repeatedly in the arm. I'm sure it's not the first time that that had ever happened. It's like, come on Momoa... You're going to dig yourself a deeper hole with Aquaman already since being outspoken on his Instagram last week about his political beliefs. Now if he defends her instead of stepping up and saying something in defense of Johnny Depp, even with ALL OF THE EVIDENCE AGAINST HER, then he's a hypocrite and I won't watch his movies anymore either along with AH.

snippet.textDisplay: Given that Jason Momoa hasn't said anything in Amber defense its very likely he had some experience with her  that doesn't paint her in a good light. That aside he likely doesn't have enough experience to want to comment on her since it would cloud the issue and  cause him unneeded grieve. But given his silence in defending her he likely seen enough to suspect that Depp is telling the truth and wouldn't be remotely upset if she was fired from the movie. That's one of the most telling things people tend to miss is that no one in the industry is coming to her defense yet they have for Depp.

snippet.textDisplay: Even though I hope this is not true (mainly because I love Joss Whedon & everything he’s created), Ray Fisher doesn’t seem like a liar. Also, condemning a studio because they allowed their Actors to be treated poorly isn’t something a barely known Actor would want to risk, especially a Black one. The fact that Jason Momoa backs up Fisher’s statement shows that something went down. Hell, for all we know, that might be the reason why both Ben Affleck & Henry Cavill were talking about leaving their coveted roles.

snippet.textDisplay: Jason Momoa is married to the beautiful Lisa Bonet. Let's not forget she spoke out about her tv dad, Bill Cosby, and his "sinister" energy. snippet.textDisplay: The abuse has been going on since the beginning. It's the hours they're working and conditions. Your on set( wet) cold , waiting for the scene to be reset...20 hours a day straight. I think what Jason means is that the actors are not treated human... more like a prop than a person. And once you sign the contract your theirs. Yes they're paid well but you don't expect to be treated like an object that can not feel .

snippet.textDisplay: Amber will have said something creepy to Jason at some point which has put him on his guard with her. There seems to be quite a list of men who she's done that with, like the guy from the car program who said she made a comment about them being alone in a downstairs car park and she could claim anything had happened. This is her M.O. Jason is quite right to be as distant as he can from her. Just because you have to work with someone, doesn't mean that you have to like them. I wonder who is under her thumb that she's threatened at WB. Once she's been proved a liar in the UK courts, a whole new "me too" movement of men who were put in the same position by Amber will emerge.

snippet.textDisplay:
I think WBs, in a time of loss of revenue with filming and Covid 19, is saying nothing at the moment because they are awaiting verdicts. I believe they will constructively disregard her contract. Either by making sure the start filming during the trial, where she wont be able to attend, or just by saying, in light of recient events..Amber heard is being removed from Aquaman. Remember, they have alot of money to recoup because of the pandemic and they are making a "Family friendly" film. Most actor contracts have a clause in them stating that if the actor gets into any type of trouble personally, etc, they have the right to discontinue the contract.

Many of Depp fans and there are alot, will be boycotting the movie because of Heard. People are still afraid of not socially distancing and won't take their kids to the theaters, and others whom are seeing her and her lies in action may question supporting the film. That is a great deal of lost revenue lost right there. In these times is she worth being in the film if its going to tank.

I do believe this is why WBs is keeping tight lipped about it. Her disappearance from the aquaman covers and posters I believe is a huge hint. Why create all that merchandise with her on it, wasting more money, when they know the woman is probably going to lose her case. Even the Sun case has a high potential for a loss due to fact checking nothing!

Let's hope WB is creatively discharging her!
